content:
@Frank Steffahn we have prioritized issues #85863 and #85873 as P-critical based on the current context. Personally I kind of feel that also T-lang might be interested in discussing this, makes sense?
In any case, if today you want to jump in and provide more context, feel free to do so.

Today's team compiler agenda is:
https://hackmd.io/wCIbJPBKSxKeScnuh3dr2Q?view
and thanks for the analysis on these two issues

if today you want to jump in and provide more context, feel free to do so

Sure, I can do that ^^ I assume the meeting is 14:00 UTC (3 hours from now), right?

And T-lang might make sense, though the more I think about it the more it seems like the main problem in these issues is just “covariant types using marker traits on their covariant parameters resulting in potential for reaching an invalid state”. So mostly a T-libs question, not necessarily too relevant for T-lang? Although this example might be valuable in a general guideline on what to keep in mind around specialization, and T-lang is relevant for the ongoing design of sound specialization. I don’t know…

maybe regarding my proposed

if, somehow, specialization would also consider types such as fn(&()) and fn(&'static ()) to be “the same type”

fix. Which – by the way – seems less reasonable to me now than it felt when I created the issue, and I found that #56105 is probably relevant around any potential discussion for considering this option. Anyway, in case this is seen as a reasonable approach to fix these issues, then T-lang would become very relevant.
I guess, T-lang could also be tagged and then be asked to decide themselves if they are interested in staying tagged.
